bibl.title: Moses Keokuk v. Albert Wiley. Arrest
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
The United States
v
Keokuk, Man to Wa
Wa Co Mo.
KaKa Na pe quah }

Whereas the defendant Keokuk, Man to Wa; Wa, Co, Mo; Ka Ka Nape Quah; have been arrested on a warrant by me issued on the complaint of Albert Wiley United States Indian agent for the Sac & Fox Indian tribe and said defendants having been broiught before me and examination had and said defendant told to appear before the United States District Court for the District of Kansas to be held at Topeka in said District at the first day of the next term of said court to answer to a charge of
resisting the order and authority of the United States. Each of said defendants and if required to give bail in the sum of one thousand dollars. You are hereby ordered to take and safety keep said defendants and if desired by them to accompany them to their reserve and afford them all needful means and opportunity to obtain bail; which bail when obtained is to be subjected to my approval or rejection. Given under my hand this 23d day of November AD 1868

W.P. Montgomery
U.S. Commission
for the District of Kansas
